column4: Ive got a question about mounting a NTFS drive to be writeable
basically I'm trying to remove some files on a drive because windows wont let me remove them
like said above, its experimental and extremely dangerous, but here's a page to check out:   http://www.jankratochvil.net/project/captive/
Sizzam: so if i shouldnt do it, do you have an idea of how to remove a file that windows wont let me delete?
ive already tried booting into safe mode
can you delete it in Windows Safe Mode?
lol
beat ya
is it possible that a windows process is holding onto it, even in safe mode?
its possible but I cant find any process threads attached to those files
is it in your /temp folder or anything like that
No, one file is on my desktop, the other files are on a different partition
hmm
whats the extension on the file
one is a .exe another a .dll
that leads me to believe that it may be in use
will it let you drag it into another folder or anything
No
i'll brb going to try something
unless you can narrow down an app loading at startup, maybe via msconfig,  you might be looking at using the recovery console
http://support.microsoft.com/default.aspx?scid=kb;en-us;307654
